description.narrative:
Action for Human Rights and participation in leadership (AHEDI) in a consortia with Arua district NGO network and MAYANK Anti-corruption coalition will together implement the project: Defending Women's Rights and Participation in Leadership under the following activities: SGBV Activities # Community awareness and sensitization on GBV and SEA (Sexual exploitation and abuse). # GBV Trainings # EASE (Economic and Social Empowerment. # Establishment of functional GBV referral pathways # Community events(cultural gala, games and sports, MDD).
Response # Provision of material support like sanitary pads, soap, # Cash support to GBV survivors # transport, food --- for those seeking services like medical care
Protection Activities # PSN home visit # PSN (EVS) support during distribution# transport EVS during food distribution, material support to EVS # Peace building: Community sensitization and dialogue on protection issues with DPC, CLO and Police I/C Child protection, Environment Officer # tree planting and bush burning # participants refugees some host communities and sub-county leaders # Youth engagements # Protection monitoring .

participating-org.narrative: ACTION 4 HUMAN RIGHTS & EDUCATION I AHEDI

AHEDI- UG is an Organization formed by young university graduates in the field of law and social work in July 2008 to promote, defend and protect rights of every citizen regardless of tribe and nationality; #Justice for All#. The organization has mainstreamed itsactivities in the area of GBV/VAWG, PHA victims, Women and children in conflict with the law, Land rights, Legal and social consultancy for Local governments (on Policy and legal Issues) and other vulnerable persons, working towards improving the legal framework and awareness on human rights and fundamental freedom, land and property rights. AHEDI-UG delivers holistic and citizen friendly programs with particular emphasis on GBV/VAWG,HIV/AIDs, emergency response to humanitarian issues, land rights/property ownership, psycho-social support, legal and social consultancy that leads to sustainable development and livelihood. AHEDI-UG works with a number of partners in the execution of its mission including political and technocrats at the districts of west Nile sub region and Uganda at large, members of parliament (MP), traditional leaders, central government representatives, other NGOs, CBOs and Faith base leaders among others. The turning point in the development of this Organization came in 2010 when West Nile civil society organizations identified the Organization to Coordinate We Can Campaign Project Funded by Oxfam in West Nile, (thus bringing all West Nile GBV actors together both state and none state Actors) a program that ran for 6 years in which AHEDI-UG mobilized and brought together 169 state and non-state GBV actors and with them, recruited 16,000 charge makers across all the districts of West Nile Nile. Although the project ended, AHEDI- UG has managed to sustain this members through various advocacy engagements resulting to enactments of 7 (seven) district level ordinances to address a base line campaign findings carried in 2013 under Oxfam funded We Can Campaign. To date, AHEDI- UG has continued to build on this coalition to address GBV issues in the region and now, the Organization is, in Partnership with EU, implementing 923,730,000/ project to empower Women Market vendors in Arua District to end GBV, a project that arose out of We Can Campaign Base line survey supra.
1.ACHIEVEMENTS Today AHEDI-UG in partnership with Arua district Local government is providing technical assistance to the District council and has being charged by council to guide and ensure production of Alcohol Control Ordinance, Charcoal and wood fuelcontrol Ordinance and Education Ordinance Amendment Bill 2018. The same partnership is with the districts of Maracha and Koboko on Education, Food security and Local Council Court Committee Development Training. This is an achievement for us in the area of Policy and legal support to Local Governments to address issues of GBV policy gaps. AHEDI-UG continued to work with ELNHA members to address emergency refugee issues in the settlement, with a support from Oxfam through CEFORD and played amajor role in the period when host communities rose against the relief aid workers in Oriama, Imvepi and Rigbo sub counties. This was successful interventions that restore peace and harmony among the actors. This intervention achieved AHEDI-UG strategic objectiveforpeaceful resolution of conflicts as opposed to court litigation and war in the region of operation Today with funding support from EU, AHEDI-UG targets to transform 14 VSLA#s in to cooperative societies so that they have legal status to compete and win funds from government programs and have capacity to defend, protect and jointly advocate for their rights under one umbrella. 3. INSTITUTIONAL PURPOSE Mission: Mission: What is the current purpose of the organisation? AHEDI-UG vision is that all women, girls and men alike live in peaceful and just environment where enjoyment of human rights is promoted, defended and protected Institutional objectives: Five years vision for AHEDI-UG. CONTEXT In the year 2020 greater acceptance and full inclusion by the community, improved services and more prevalence will be added socio-economic quality of women, children and other special interest groups of persons affected and infected HIV/AIDs, PWDs and indigent persons. At the same time, because of population growth, the ageing population and higher incidences of multiple diagnoses, the rights of women, girls, children and other indigent persons will remain extensive and varied. While significant strives will have been made in observance of the rights of women and girls, and to bridge the gap in implementation of Domestic laws and policies in protecting, promoting and defending the rights of women and other vulnerable persons in the community, there will be an ongoing push for community inclusion and participation. Finally women and other special interest groups of persons like affected and infected with HIV/AIDs, PWDs and indigent persons will control more resources and decisions about who provide them with help and support. Field(s) of activity: What are the principal thematic and geographic areas in which the organisationworks? Who are the social actors that benefit from the work? ROLE AND PROGRRAMME SERVICES Action for Human Rights and Education Initiative #Uganda is the lead in bringing up communities in identifying needs and all kinds of resources and services for her primaryand secondary beneficiaries to support full long term community inclusion of women and other vulnerable persons in determining their destiny and choice of life. Specifically AHEDI-UG will:- # Lead collaboration of providers and community groups /organizations, government departments and programs in the region and from surrounding areas, as appropriate, identifying needs and gaps in the services. # Directly provide cutting#edge, model services that meet identified gaps. # AHEDI-UG may not strive to provide comprehensive services itself BUT direct services it does provide are of the highest quality. # Collaborates with and make key referrals to other high quality services providers and # Lead many advocacy efforts to ensure services are provided either by AHEDI-UG or other providers. # AHEDI-UG will play a leadership role in advocating at all levels of government, and with private sector and the public at largefor elimination of GBV and VAW, promote food security and nutrition, water and sanitation in the community and general awareness creation in human rights and fundamental freedoms of persons affected and infected with HIV/AIDs most especially women and children. # Encourage and support victims of GBV and VAW in pursuing this advocacy agenda. 4. STRATEGIC POSITIONING Analyse the environment inwhich the organisation works? Who are the other relevant social actors, including government and business, and what roles do they play? ' In this context, what is unique about the position of the organisation? MISSION OF AHEDI-UG Achieving full personal human life for women, girls and other vulnerable community members and create an environment 1. Addressing women and girls accessto justice and challenging the concept of socio- economic practices that perpetrate domestic violence and violence against women through application of religious, cultural and traditional laws. 2. Strengthening the rights basedapproach and human rights monitoringcapacities for women groups/ organisation and persons affected and infected with HIV/ AIDS at grass root levels. 3. Engaging district leadership in the West Nile region build capacity to reduce GENDER and other disparities in relation to increased access to and completion of quality basic education through promotion of girl child education. 4. Engaging both political and civic leadership in West Nile region to address disparity between existing policies and domesticlaws with practices in the communities in specific reference to women#s socio economic rights. 5. Recognising, supporting and protecting women working in the informal sector livelihood and promoting their economic roles in the society.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
